43.title: "Donald dans tous ses États"
43.author: Jean-Paul Jennequin
43.appears_in: p. 26-29 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 9 (Oct. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Durant plus de vingt ans, Carl Barks anime, dans les pages de Walt Disney's Comics and Stories, un chronique burlesque du quotidien américain. Au centre de cet univers suburbain, un canard au caractère explosif: Donald. Humain, trop humain..."

English summary (from p. 126): "Donald's Mishaps: The short Donald stories are mostly set in Duckburg and mainly feature Gladstone Gander's character. Jean-Paul Jennequin studies the various forms of adversity Donald has to face in these tales."

104.title: Donald Duck
104.author: by Walt Disney.
notes: Summary: The boys are told to put their bikes in the garage; they break the flashlight so they put up Christmas lights to illuminate the job.

105.title: Donald Duck
105.author: [No author]
105.series: Aug. 28, 1942) "We Can't Mow The Lawn, Unca Donald, The Mower Broke!"*
notes: Summary: The boys broke the lawnmower with a sledghammer; Donald watches them from his hammock while they cut it with scissors.

106.title: Donald Duck
106.author: by Walt Disney.
notes: Summary: Donald makes it to the theater just in time for the newsreel; the headline is "Navy Lays Smoke Screen," and he remembers he left something in the oven.

107.title: Donald Duck
107.author: Walt Disney.
107.series: Dec. 28, 1942) "Would we hafta got to school if it snowed way up over the windows?"*
notes: Summary: Huey, Dewey and Louie arrange for snow to cover the bedroom window.

140.title: Donald Duck
140.author: by Walt Disney.
notes: Summary: A man has his lawn sprinkler and hose on the sidewalk; Donald replaces is front bicycle wheel with a rotary saw blade before he rides over it.

148.title: Donald Duck
148.author: [No author]
148.series: Jan. 13, 1953) "We Don't Eat Dog Food, and He Can't Read!"*
notes: Summary: Donald has bought a new dish for the pup with his name on it ("Fido"), and Louie says he got took.

149.title: Donald Duck
149.author: [No author]
149.series: Jan. 17, 1953) "I Finally Shot Par on the Tenlakes Golf Course"*
notes: Summary: Because the lakes are frozen, Donald has been golfing in ice skates.

150.title: Donald Duck
150.author: Walt Disney.
150.series: Jan. 26, 1953) "I'll Take the Biggest One You Have"*
notes: Summary: Donald is selling brushes door-to-door, and the customer has a little boy that needs spanking.

151.title: Donald Duck
151.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: An angry golf course manager is fooled by Donald's wearing his latest divot on his head.

152.title: Donald Duck
152.author: Walt Disney.
152.series: Mar. 9, 1953) "They Charged as Much as Ever"*
notes: Summary: Donald sends the boys to get groceries in raggedy clothes, but it doesn't help.

153.title: Donald Duck
153.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Donald searches for a quiet place to live and moves into a building with only a quill-pen writer and a career cheese taster as neighbors. Both are by nature silent men, but Donald provokes them to feats of loudness and Donald ends up with a hearing aid.

155.title: Donald Duck

156.title: Donald Duck
156.author: art by Tony Strobl and John Liggera

157.title: Donald Duck
157.author: [No author]
157.series: June 11, 1959) "That Was The Day I First Broke A Hundred!"*
notes: Summary: Daisy feels neglected by golf-playing Donald, and bets he can't remember the day they met.

160.title: Donald Duck
160.author: story and pencils by Daan Jippes ; inks by Ben Verhagen ; English script by Byron Erickson ; lettering by John Clark ; coloring by Mike McCormick

notes: Title as assigned in WDC&S no. 600, where it was colored by Barry Englin.

161.title: Donald Duck
161.author: by William Van Horn
161.appears_in: 10 p. in Walt Disney's Comics & Stories, no. 596 (Apr. 1995)
notes: SUMMARY: Donald's new year's resolution not to get mad (angry) is first reinforced and then reversed by a Gyro Gearloose invention, the Resolution Hat. Donald goes into a continuous tantrum.
